到達目標:
Students will be
able to:

*identify types of
figurative language and imagery, and generate original examples

*identify the
strengths of effectively written paragraphs, and write one or more examples

*experiment with
writing creative non-fiction, personal essays, short fiction and hybrid pieces

* write effective and
vivid descriptions

*demonstrate the
key skills used in writing an effective persuasive creative non-fiction piece/essay

*write personal
essays about several different topics, including language, place, nature and/or
science

*apply good
revision techniques to polish writing samples

*generate collaborative
writing with classmates
授業の概要・背景: In this class, students will learn paragraph writing and essay writing skills. Students will study examples of expressive writing in the genre of personal essay, creative non-fiction/essay, with brief explorations in short fiction and hybrid writing, and will become familiar with the techniques that authors use to write effective pieces. Students will then apply these techniques in generating their own original pieces. In doing so, students will come to understand more deeply the structure of English on the sentence level and on the paragraph level. Students will also increase their mastery of English by exploring metaphor and other types of figurative language, skills which will cross over to help them write livelier pieces in their academic careers. Practice writing descriptions will encourage students to observe carefully and be able to effectively convey their observations and analysis in English. Additionally, students will practice collaborative writing with fellow students. Students will also be responsible for reading the work of classmates and making useful and constructive comments about these pieces. This course will allow students to increase competence, comfort, and pleasure in their use of English.

第1回:
Lecture: What is expressive writing? What is genre? Figurative language and imagery.

Group Work: Generate original examples of figurative language.

Figurative language worksheet.

Read the reading about creative nonfiction/essay prepared by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this reading in the next class.
第2回:
Group work: Compare figurative language worksheet homework in small groups.

Lecture: Introduction to creative non-fiction/essay. What is it? Definitions and examples.

Discussion: Discuss the homework readings about creative nonfiction.
Read the descriptive essay(s) prepared by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第3回:
Lecture: Introduction to descriptive essays/descriptive creative non-fiction.

Discussion: Discuss the examples from the homework reading.

Class Activity: Begin writing a paragraph of descriptive writing.

Write a descriptive paragraph.

Read the readings about place provided by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第4回:
Group Work: In small groups, read and discuss one another’s paragraph of descriptive writing.

Lecture: Writing about place.

Discussion: Discuss the examples from the homework reading.

Read the readings about language provided by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.

Write a short paragraph about place.
第5回:
Group Work: In small groups, read and discuss one another’s paragraphs about place.

Lecture: Writing about language.

Discussion: Class discussion about language essay examples.

Begin personal essay/creative non-fiction piece due in Class 7. (Topic choices: place or language. Choose one.)

Read the reading about how to begin a creative nonfiction piece/personal essay, prepared by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this reading in the next class.
第6回:
Lecture: How to begin a creative non-fiction piece.

Discussion: Brainstorming ideas about how to begin essays.

Pair Work: Generate an effective beginning paragraph to a hypothetical creative essay.

Finish personal essay/creative non-fiction piece due in Class 7. (Choose one of these topics: place or  language.)

Read the reading about motivated/persuasive essays prepared by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第7回:
Pair Work: Read and comment on a classmate’s personal essay/creative nonfiction assignment.

Lecture: Motivated/persuasive essays.

Group Discussion: Discuss the examples read for homework.
Read the reading about creative non-fiction and science writing prepared by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第8回:
Lecture: Creative non-fiction for science/nature writing.

Discussion: Discuss the reading assignment.

Pair Work: Brainstorming science themes for non-fiction.
Read the reading assignment about the braided essay form provided by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第9回:
Lecture: The braided essay form.

Discussion: Discuss examples from the reading assignment.

Homework:

Begin personal essay/creative nonfiction piece 2, due in Class 11. (Choose one of these topics: persuasive writing, science writing, nature writing, or braided essay.)

Read the reading assignment about short fiction provided by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第10回:
Lecture: Short fiction. Flash fiction and short shorts.

Discussion: Discuss the examples from the homework reading.

Group Work: Discuss examples given in class in small groups.

Work on personal essay/creative nonfiction piece 2, due in Class 11. (Topics: persuasive writing, science writing, nature writing, braided essay. Choose one.)

Read the short fiction readings provided by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.

Write a one-sentence short story.
第11回:
Pair Work: Read a classmate’s one-sentence short story and comment.

Lecture: More short fiction. The practice of short fiction.

Group Work: Discuss examples given in class in small groups.

Begin short fiction assignment, due Class 13.

Read the reading about revision techniques provided by the teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.
第12回:
Lecture: Revision techniques.

Class Work: Apply a revision technique to one of your previous writing samples.

Read the reading about hybrid forms provided by teacher. Be prepared to discuss this/these reading(s) in the next class.

Finish short fiction assignment due in Class 13.

Finish applying one or more revision techniques to a previous writing sample, due Class 14.
第13回:
Lecture: Hybrid forms.

Discussion: Discuss hybrid form examples read for homework.

Hybrid form writing assignment (due Class 14).

Finish applying one or more revision techniques to a previous writing sample, due Class 14.

Finish any outstanding assignments (any assignments that are overdue).
第14回:
Pair Work: Compare classmate’s revised piece with the original piece, and comment.

Pair Work: Read classmate’s hybrid piece and comment.

Lecture: Erasure and found forms.

Activity: Collaborative writing activities, and erasure writing activity.

name: 【500】英語エクスプレッシブ・ライティング　２／Expressive Writing in English
担当者: ウエノ　ジェシカ（UENO JESSICA GOODFELLOW）
成績評価備考:
備考　Note
Term Paper: Personal Essay/Creative Nonfiction Piece 1 &  Personal Essay/Creative Nonfiction Piece 2 
Individual Reports: Short Fiction Piece, Revision Piece, & Hybrid Piece 
Class participation includes each student making an observation about the homework reading assignment each class, at a minimum.
ALL writing assignments must be submitted for successful completion of this course.
